title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
overview: Through the innocent eyes of Bruno, the eight-year-old son of the commandant at a German concentration camp, a forbidden friendship with a Jewish boy on the other side of the camp fence has startling and unexpected consequences.

title: Under sandet
overview: In post-World War II Denmark, a group of young German POWs are forced to clear a beach of thousands of land mines under the watch of a Danish Sergeant who slowly learns to appreciate their plight.

title: Black Hawk Down
overview: 160 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.

title: Kagemusha
overview: A petty thief with an utter resemblance to a samurai warlord is hired as the lord's double. When the warlord later dies the thief is forced to take up arms in his place.

title: Beasts of No Nation
overview: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
overview: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land. They travel to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

title: Gone with the Wind
overview: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

title: The Deer Hunter
overview: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.

title: Judgment at Nuremberg
overview: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazis judged for war crimes.

title: The Trial of the Chicago 7
overview: The story of 7 people on trial stemming from various charges surrounding the uprising at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Zulu
overview: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

title: All Quiet on the Western Front
overview: A German youth eagerly enters World War I, but his enthusiasm wanes as he gets a firsthand view of the horror.

title: Bridge of Spies
overview: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

title: Lifeboat
overview: Several survivors of a torpedoed merchant ship in World War II find themselves in the same lifeboat with one of the crew members of the U-boat that sank their ship.

title: Doctor Zhivago
overview: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution.

title: Bronenosets Potemkin
overview: In the midst of the Russian Revolution of 1905, the crew of the battleship Potemkin mutiny against the brutal, tyrannical regime of the vessel's officers. The resulting street demonstration in Odessa brings on a police massacre.

title: Paths of Glory
overview: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

title: The Thin Red Line
overview: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

title: Ivanovo detstvo
overview: In WW2, twelve year old Soviet orphan Ivan Bondarev works for the Soviet army as a scout behind the German lines and strikes a friendship with three sympathetic Soviet officers.

title: Giù la testa
overview: A low-life bandit and an I.R.A. explosives expert rebel against the government and become heroes of the Mexican Revolution.
